question: I am a 42 year old women and I recently had a pelvic ultrasound as well as a transvaginal ultrasound.  My doctor said that I need to have a CAT scan as there is water BEHIND my uterus.  She says that this is normal for premenopausal women but not for post menopausal, which I am.  I went into premature menopause 3 years ago.  I have had a lot of medical issues including diabetes which I have had since age 19 or 20.  I did have a LEAP procedure done when I was about 23 years old for pre cancerous cells in the cervix.  I also have several complications from the diabetes including 3rd stage kidney failure and extensive nerve damage in my legs, hands and stomach.  I have always been a healthy weight, but in the last 18 months I suddenly gained 30 pounds and no matter what I do I can not lose the weight.  I don\t know if this has any bearing on the uterus but everything I have been reading points to uterus cancer.  My doctor won't speculate until after I have my CAT scan, which I understand.  Are there any other reasons for water behind (not in) the uterus?  Please help as this is causing me a bit of concern but I'm not going to panic until I have a reason to be stressed.  Thanks for any info you might have.
title: Water behind the uterus
